column4: it was from my iBook, which suddenly died. it would boot up to even a livecd; after diagnosing the problem on several forums, it was a logic board problem
(i had experienced the exact symptoms 5 months earlier, and had the logic board replaced, this 2nd time around, my applecare had expired.
it was from a g4, ppc ibook (circa 2005)
I've did a bit of searching on it (on the ubuntu forums) and there is very little information on it.
it's still an hfs+ formatted hd
k
thank you ikonia
is that hfs+ drive comming from your mac ?
i removed the hard drive from the mac
did you have Journaling enabled on that mac ?
i'm not sure.
because ubuntu can't read from hfs+ drives with journaling enabled... if it was enabled, you have to disable Journaling using a mac computer
it was from a general consumer ibook g4, so i'm not sure if I had configured it or not.
meh.
i had the Journaling problem, there's only one way to solve it.
but if it isn't that, i can't help you any further (my knowledge isn't big) :)
which is to disable journaling in mac os x ?
to disable journaling in mac osx, you must use 'diskutily'
read here: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=2346494
i'm not sure if your problem is Journaling-related, but it could be if it's a hfs+ drive
and ikonia: i'm not trying to write to the disk, just read it, so i can copy my data over to my ext3-formatted hd
